university.mekportal.desc3: They can be placed in &6any orientation&r; they can be horizontal, sideways, etc.
university.mekportal.desc4: Open the Teleporter block's GUI, optionally switch to Private mode if you only want yourself to be able to use it, and enter a name into the "Set" textbox to &6create a frequency&r.
university.mekportal.desc5: At other Teleporters, &6choose that frequency out of the list&r and click "Set."
university.mekportal.desc6: They really &6only work normally in pairs&r. If you add more, the additional ones all go to the first Teleporter. Entering the first Teleporter will always send you to the second Teleporter.
university.portableteleport.title: Porta-Port
university.portableteleport.subtitle: Make a Portable Teleporter
university.portableteleport.desc: The &bPortable Teleporter&r, when used, will allow you to pick a teleporter frequency, and then teleports you to the nearest Teleporter on it.
university.digitalminer.subtitle: Make a Digital Miner
university.digitalminer.desc1: The &bDigital Miner&r will search an area (default radius 10 blocks, max 32), scan it according to filters, and then mine those blocks and store their drops.
university.digitalminer.desc2: Click &6Config&r to set the filters, the radius, the minimum, and maximum y levels it checks, and Inverse mode (making filters act as a blacklist).
university.digitalminer.desc3: Once your filters are set (I recommend a Tag filter for "forge:ores"), click &6Start&r and let it run.
university.digitalminer.desc4: There are several more buttons on the main menu:
university.digitalminer.desc5: • &6Reset&r, which resets the block-mining position and allows you to change filters again.
university.digitalminer.desc6: • &6Auto-eject&r, which makes it automatically push items out the back.
university.digitalminer.desc7: • &6Silk touch&r, which applies a Silk Touch enchantment at the cost of additional FE.
university.digitalminer.desc8: • &6Auto-pull&r, which will replace mined blocks with a block from the inventory above itself.
university.digitalminer.desc9: You can also install upgrades in the top-right button menu.
university.rftsyringe.title: And That's How I Lost My Medical License
university.rftsyringe.subtitle: Make a Syringe
university.rftsyringe.desc: Filled &bSyringes&r are required to craft Modules. To fill a Syringe, hold it in your hands, and attack a mob.
university.rftspawner.subtitle: Make a Spawner system
university.rftspawner.desc1: The &bSpawner&r works in tandem with the &bMatter Beamer&r to spawn any mob, using a certain amount of three items.
university.rftspawner.desc2: Place and power the Spawner, and then place and power three Matter Beamers nearby. Use a Smart Wrench on a Beamer then on the Spawner to bind them together.
university.rftspawner.desc3: Place a full &bSyringe&r (which you fill by punching mobs with it) into the top right slot of the Spawner. There, you can see the items and the amount you need to spawn that mob.
university.rftspawner.desc4: Mobs need &6key matter&r, &6bulk matter&r, and &6living matter&r. The key and bulk matters depend on the mob you're spawning, but living matter accepts any plant or animal drop.
university.rftelevator.subtitle: Make an Elevator system
university.rftelevator.desc1: &bElevators&r can smoothly send a platform up and down, bringing you with it. Place the bottom floor first and give it power, then build the platform touching the Elevator's front face.
university.rftelevator.desc2: Place the other floor's Elevators &6directly above it&r where you want the platform to stop. When any Elevator gets a redstone signal, the platform will be sent to it. &6You only need to provide the bottom floor's Elevator with power.&r
university.rftelevator.desc3: Elevators (and their passengers) will &6phase through any solid block in the way&r. You will still take &csuffocation damage&r, however.
university.rftelevatorscreen.subtitle: Make an Elevator Button Screen Module
university.rftelevatorscreen.desc1: It's frustrating to make a complex redstone circuit that allows you to send a signal to any Elevator from any other Elevator. You can use a &bElevator Button Screen Module&r to do this easier.
university.rftelevatorscreen.desc2: Sneak right-click the Module on the Elevator floor you're on, then put it in a powered Screen nearby (&6Elevators can phase through Screens&r, so you don't have to put it outside the shaft). Repeat this for every floor.
university.rftelevatorscreen.desc3: In the Module's GUI, you can choose the colors for the current floor and the other floors, the button style, the button &osize&r, and the names of 8 floors.
university.rftelevatorscreen.desc4: Simply &6right-click one of the buttons&r on the Screen to be sent to that floor.
university.rftshapecard.subtitle: Make a Shape Card
university.rftshapecard.desc1: &bShape Cards&r are used in several machines in RFTools. They allow you to &6set the working area&r of those machines.
university.rftshapecard.desc2: Right-click the Shape Card to set the shape and size, as well as the offset and if it's solid or hollow.
university.rftcomposer.subtitle: Make a Composer
university.rftcomposer.desc1: The &bComposer&r allows you to combine several Shape Cards into one final shape.
university.rftcomposer.desc2: Put all the shapes you want to combine in the top slots and the final Shape Card in the bottom.
university.rftprojector.subtitle: Make a Projector
university.rftprojector.desc1: The &bProjector&r will &6display a hologram of the Shape Card&r inserted into it.
university.rftprojector.desc2: You can also set its angle, scale, and offset, as well as how a redstone signal from any side will affect it.
university.rftbuilder.title: The Actual Best Thing
university.rftbuilder.subtitle: Make a Builder
university.rftbuilder.desc1: The &bBuilder&r will &6fill in an area&r set by a Shape Card &6using blocks from the inventory above it&r.
university.rftbuilder.desc2: You can also &6sneak right-click a Shape Card onto it&r, then click two corners to set the working area.
university.rftquarry.title: &lDiggy Diggy Hole&r
university.rftquarry.subtitle: Make a Shape Card (Quarry)
university.rftquarry.desc1: The &bShape Card (Quarry)&r works like a regular Shape Card, except Builders will &omine&r the working area instead of placing blocks.
university.rftquarry.desc2: Blocks mined will insert their drops (as if mined with a regular pickaxe) into the inventory above the Builder. These blocks will be replaced with Dirt.
university.rftquarry.desc3: This is honestly the &6best way to get resources&r the majority of the time. Put it down somewhere that won't annoy anyone, set it to the maximum possible size, and just let it run! Don't forget to set the shape not to be hollow.
university.rftquarry.desc4: The &bShape Card (Clearing Quarry)&r works exactly the same as a regular Quarry card, except instead of replacing blocks with Dirt, it just leaves a hole.
university.rftquarryupgrades.title: Shape Card (Quarry (Fortune (Clearing))
university.rftquarryupgrades.subtitle: Make an upgraded Shape Card (Quarry)
university.rftquarryupgrades.desc1: The &bShape Card (Fortune Quarry)&r works exactly like a regular Quarry card, except it &6applies a Fortune III enchantment to drops&r. Each block mined costs twice as much FE as a regular Quarry card.
university.rftquarryupgrades.desc2: The &bShape Card (Silk Quarry)&r does the same, except with &6Silk Touch&r. Each mined block costs three times as much FE as a regular Quarry card.
university.rftvoidcard.title: Shape Card (⬛⬛⬛⬛)
university.rftvoidcard.subtitle: Make a Shape Card (Void)
university.rftvoidcard.desc: The &bShape Card (Void)&r will &6destroy all blocks in its working area, &cleaving no drops&r. However, it requires &6zero FE&r per block, so this is great for clearing land.
university.rftpump.title: Pump it Up!
university.rftpump.subtitle: Make a Shape Card (Pump)
university.rftpump.desc1: The &bShape Card (Pump)&r will collect any fluid in its working area and deposit it into the tank directly above. Fluids sources will be replaced with Dirt.
university.rftpump.desc2: The &bShape Card (Clearing Pump)&r works exactly like a normal Pump card, except sources will not be replaced with Dirt.
university.rftplacingfluids.subtitle: Make a Shape Card (Placing Fluids)
university.rftplacingfluids.desc: The &bShape Card (Placing Fluids)&r will place fluids from the tank above itself in the working area.
university.shieldprojector.title: False Walls, Drawbridges, and Wither Killers!
university.shieldprojector.subtitle: Make a Shield Projector setup
university.shieldprojector.desc1: RFTools' &bShields&r are extremely powerful and flexible devices. They can be &6any shape&r, look like any block, have &6configurable interactions per entity&r, and be disabled with a redstone signal. They are also entirely &6unbreakable, even by Withers&r!
university.shieldprojector.desc2: Place &bShield Template&r blocks of any (single) color in the shape you want, make sure at least one of them is touching a &bShield Projector&r, and then use a &6Smart Wrench&r on the Projector. Templates of different colors will not interact with each other.
university.shieldprojector.desc3: At the top of the Projector's GUI, you can make a list of &6rules&r.
university.shieldprojector.desc4: At the top right, set what you want to happen to an entity type (whether they can pass if they get damaged, etc.).
university.shieldprojector.desc5: Below that, set what entity type you want to affect (players, items, passive or hostile mobs, etc). If you choose a player, you can specify which player in the text box below. Click &6Add&r to add that rule to the list.
university.shieldprojector.desc6: These rules here will make Shields solid to hostile mobs and damage them while letting items and the player Steve walk through them harmlessly.
university.shieldprojector.desc7: At the bottom left, you can set what the Shields look like. You can change its colors, change its texture, and even set it to mimic a block you give it.
university.shieldprojector.desc8: Additionally, you can make the Projector use a &6Shape Card&r instead of Shield Projectors by placing the Card in the bottom left slot. You still have to click it with a Smart Wrench to enable it, however.
university.shieldprojector.school.1: We've made a School to teach how Shields work! Go there by clicking
university.shieldschool.title: Shield School
university.shieldschool.subtitle: Visit the Shield School
university.school.shields.1:
&bShields&r are powerful blocks. They can be configured to
look like any block, allow certain things to pass
through, damage certain mobs, and more.

These shields are set to need Redstone,
and block everything from passing through.
&6Flip the lever to continue.&r
university.school.shields.2:
To make the shield, place &bShield Template&r blocks
where you want the shield to be, then
place a &bShield Projector&r adjacent to any.

Use a &bSmart Wrench&r on the Projector to
connect it to the Templates
university.school.shields.3:
Shield Templates of &bdifferent&r
&bcolors&r &6do not connect&r

This allows you to have
multiple separate shields
adjacent to each other
university.school.shields.4:
Shield behavior can be changed
in the Projector's GUI

This door has been
set to be &6solid for players&r, &6allow items&r
&6through&r, and turn off when powered
university.school.shields.5:
To add a rule, choose &6what happens&r
in the top right of the GUI
(if it's solid or not, if it damages, etc.),
and then choose &6who it affects&r
(everything, players, hostile/passive
mobs, etc.) underneath, then click &6Add&r

You can have &6multiple rules&r,
which show on the left

Higher rules take priority
university.school.shields.6:
Set this bridge to be solid to continue

Do so by clicking "Pass" until
it says "Solid", keep "Any"
as "Any", then click "Add".

(If collision is bugged, turn it off and
on again using Redstone Mode)
university.school.shields.7:
Shields can be made to &6deal damage&r
to whatever matches the filter

As Shields are also &6completely unbreakable&r,
they make for a good &cWither killer&r
university.school.shields.8:
This Projector is set to be &6solid&r and
&6deal player-damage&r to &6hostile mobs&r,
and be &6solid for everything else&r

When the &blever is turned off&r, the Shield
turns on and the three Builders
on the left place blocks to spawn a Wither

The Wither can't break the blocks
and is constantly damaged until
it dies, letting the items through into
the Hoppers below

&cWither Skull projectiles technically
count as items!&r You can't set items
to Pass, as then Skulls would fly everywhere!

Hoppers can still grab real items, though.
university.school.shields.9:
These Builders build the three shapes for the Wither.

You can see where they place using
the "Support/preview mode" button
university.spacechamber.title: Space Chamber
university.spacechamber.subtitle: Make a Space Chamber
university.spacechamber.desc1: The &bSpace Chamber&r is a multiblock that works in tandem with the &6Builder&r or &6Vehicle Builder&r to perform several functions. This quest will go over its Builder functions.
university.spacechamber.desc2:
It is capable of:

• &6Copying&r the contents of the Space Chamber, rebuilding it elsewhere.
• &6Teleporting&r the contents elsewhere.
• &6Swapping&r its contents with what's already at the Builder.
• &6Receiving&r a structure from a Builder.
• &6Collecting&r drops to the Builder.

Do note, the Space Chamber &ccannot interact with tile entities&r like inventories or machines.
university.spacechamber.desc3: The Space Chamber is constructed by placing a &bSpace Chamber Controller&r in one corner, and &bSpace Chambers&r in every other corner. Use a &6Smart Wrench&r on the Controller to complete it.
university.spacechamber.desc4: The above Space Chamber is 5x5x5 outside, and its contents are the &63x3x3 inside&r.
university.spacechamber.desc5: Space Chambers do not have to be cubes. They can be anywhere from 1x1x1 internal to 128x128x128.
university.spacechamber.desc6: Use a &bSpace Card&r on the Controller to link to it. Use the Card again to see what's currently inside the Chamber.
university.spacechamber.desc7: It will show you all blocks and entities, as well as the cost it takes to move them.
university.spacechamber.desc8: Insert the Space Card into a &6Builder&r, and it will connect to the linked Space Chamber. Change its settings on the left.
university.spacechamber.desc9: This Builder is set to &6collect items&r from its Chamber, and is also set to &6keep running with redstone&r rather than stopping after a single loop.
university.spacechamber.desc10: Any items that are dropped in the Space Chamber will be picked up and inserted into an inventory above the Builder.
university.spacechamber.desc11: When set like this, it will &6move&r the Chamber's blocks to the Builder. It is also set to &6move entities&r as well.
university.spacechamber.desc12: In &6copy&r mode, it will use the blocks in the inventory above the Builder to recreate what's in the Chamber. Obviously, it &ccan't copy entities&r.
university.spacechamber2.title: Simple Wither Farm
university.spacechamber2.subtitle: An example Space Chamber use
university.spacechamber2.desc1: The Space Chamber and Builder can make a very simple &bWither Builder&r!
university.spacechamber2.desc2: Build a Wither (with the Soul Sand last) in a Space Chamber, and set a Builder to &6copy&r it.
university.spacechamber2.desc3: The Builder will copy &6from the bottom up&r, spawning the Wither. This screenshot was taken in Peaceful Mode, which is why it didn't spawn.
university.spacechamber2.desc4: Be warned, however: The Bulder &cwill not offset the structure&r!
university.spacechamber2.desc5: If you want to have the Wither spawn somewhere farther away, &6make the Chamber larger&r with some empty space, and build the structure at the offset.
university.rftmover.title: Great Glass Elevator
university.rftmover.subtitle: Make a Vehicle and Movers
university.rftmover.desc1: Long-time players might remember the &6Elevators&r that were in older versions of RFTools. In modern versions, they've been replaced by &bMovers&r.
university.rftmover.desc2: Movers can move a &6Vehicle&r (made up of the contents of a Space Chamber) in any direction, not just up or down.
university.rftmover.desc3: First, in a Space Chamber, &bmake your Vehicle&r. It can be made out of any blocks, except for tile entities.
university.rftmover.desc4: In a &bVehicle Builder&r, insert a &6Space Card&r linked to the Chamber, as well as a &bVehicle Card&r.
university.rftmover.desc5: Name the Vehicle, and then click &6Create&r. You can also &6rotate the Vehicle&r to face a different direction if you want.
university.rftmover.desc6: Once the Vehicle has been saved to a Card, you can dismantle your Space Chamber.
university.rftmover.desc7: Place and power a &bMover Controller&r, and place a &bMover&r adjacent.
university.rftmover.desc8: Insert the Vehicle Card into the Mover, and it will &6project a copy of the Vehicle&r.
university.rftmover.desc9: The Vehicle is &calways held in the south-east of the Mover&r, no matter how the Space Chamber was constructed! You can &6offset it in the Mover Controller&r.
university.rftmover.desc10: Place more Movers at each &6destination&r you want the Vehicle to stop at. Vehicles &ccan only move in straight lines&r, so the Movers must be as well.
university.rftmover.desc11: In the Controller's GUI, click &6Scan&r to connect Movers. You can name Movers in their GUIs to make them easier to use.
university.rftmover.desc12: Here, Adjacent is the Mover touching the Controller, Right is the one to the right, etc.
university.rftmover.desc13: To move a Vehicle, click it from the list on the right and click its destination on the left, then click &6Move&r.
university.rftmover.desc14: When a Vehicle is moved, &6all entities standing on it are as well&r. The &6Vehicle Card moves with its Vehicle&r.
university.rftmover.desc15: If you &cexperience collision bugs&r, move the Vehicle away and then bring it back to fix it.
university.rftmover.desc16: The next several quests will cover more details about Vehicles.
university.moveblocks.subtitle: Make Move Controls
university.moveblocks.desc1: Vehicles aren't handy if you have to be outside them to control them.
university.moveblocks.desc2: &bMove Controls&r, if built into the Vehicle, will allow you to &6move to a destination&r by clicking it from a list.
university.moveblocks.desc3: If there are too many destinations to fit, you can place the Page 2-4 Mover Controllers to extend the list.
university.moveblocks.desc4: The &bMover Status&r will show which Mover the Vehicle is at now and where it's going.
university.moveblocks.desc5: What it looks like when building:
university.moveblocks.desc6: What it looks like as a Vehicle:
university.rftmover2.title: Traffic
university.rftmover2.subtitle: Intelligent Mover placement
university.rftmover2.desc1: Two Vehicles &ccannot share the same Mover&r. As a consequence, Vehicles &6cannot pass through occupied Movers&r either.
university.rftmover2.desc2: Here, the red Vehicle cannot move at all since all possible destinations are blocked by the Blue vehicle.
university.rftmover2.desc3: The only way the red Vehicle would be able to move is if the blue Vehicle moved out of the way first.
university.rftmover2.desc4: A possible workaround for this would be to have &6dedicated travel-only Movers&r, which you aren't supposed to park at.
university.rftmover2.desc5: Then, each &oactual&r destination Mover only has a single direct connection: one of those "road" Movers.
university.rftmover2.desc6: Alternatively, you could have &6several parallel paths&r, so the Vehicle can simply move around obstructions.
university.rftprogrammer.title: If This Then That
university.rftprogrammer.subtitle: Make a Programmer
university.rftprogrammer.desc1: &eRFTools Control&r allows you to &6make programs visually by linking tiles&r. If you've ever used the program Scratch, it's similar to that.
university.rftprogrammer.desc2: On the left of the &bProgrammer&r is a list of tiles, called &6opcodes&r. You drag these to the grid on the right to add them to the program.
university.rftprogrammer.desc3: You can insert a &bProgram Card&r and click &6Save&r to save the program to the card. Load loads from the card, and so on. &3This quest has 2 Program rewards. Load them and read the comments to see how they work.&r
university.rftprogrammer.desc4: Programs are triggered by &6Event&r opcodes. When a &othing&r happens (depending on the Event), it triggers the connected tile to do something. Some Events are &6Redstone On&r and &6Off&r, &6Repeat&r, etc. Hold shift while hovering over one to see what it does.
university.rftprogrammer.desc5: Opcodes that are not properly configured will have a flashing icon on them. Click it, and you can configure it at the bottom. This Repeat event is set to trigger every second:
university.rftprogrammer.desc6: Double click on a grey blob on a tile's edge to &6aim&r it. When triggered, it will pass the trigger in that direction.
university.rftprogrammer.desc7: &6Operation&r opcodes do something when triggered. These tend to be more complex; see their tooltip for a detailed explanation. This program says something in the log every time it is triggered:
university.rftprogrammer.desc8: &6Eval&r opcodes take some sort of input (like a redstone signal strength) and turn it into a text output.
university.rftprogrammer.desc9: &6Test&r opcodes can be aimed in two directions: the &agreen&r path is taken if the test passes; the &cred&r path is taken if it fails.
university.rftprocessor.subtitle: Make a Processor
university.rftprocessor.desc1: The &bProcessor&r is what &6runs programs&r. You need to have a &bCPU&r to do anything; higher tiers can do more at a time.
university.rftprocessor.desc2: Insert Program Cards into the top slots, and they will start running. The black box under is the &6log&r: any Log Message operation will display here.
university.rftprocessor.desc3: You can also type some commands in the text box under the log. &7help&r will show you all available commands.
university.rftprocessor.desc4: Any opcodes that have a &6side parameter&r will use that side of the Processor; Up will use the top, etc.
university.rftcram.title: Variables
university.rftcram.subtitle: Make some RAM
university.rftcram.desc1: &bRAM&r is required for programs to use &6variables&r. Each RAM Chip adds 8 variables, to a max of 32 to a Processor.
university.rftcram.desc2: Variables are essentially a way to &6store a value to use elsewhere&r. Basically, any opcode that takes a value can be pointed at a variable instead.
university.rftcram.desc3: You must &6allocate&r variable slots to Program Cards in the Processor. See the &nResource Allocation&r quest for more details.
university.resourceallocation.title: Resource Allocation
university.resourceallocation.subtitle: Learn how resource allocation works
university.resourceallocation.desc1: Programs that &6use variables&r or &6move items&r must be allocated the specific slots it has available.
university.resourceallocation.desc2: Above the Program Card, click the &bResource Allocation&r button. This allows you to click the inventory slots on the right, or the variable slots on the left, to &6allocate those resources to the program&r, allowing it access to them.
university.resourceallocation.desc3: Here, the program is allocated the top 3 slots of the Processor's inventory:
university.resourceallocation.desc4: This quest gives a program as a reward. This program keeps exactly 10 Cobblestone in an inventory. Load it in a Programmer and read the comments to see how it works.
university.dbstep.title: Debugging: Your Best Friend
university.dbstep.subtitle: Learn about the DB command
university.dbstep.desc1: The &bdb&r command (in the Processor, not chat) is the best way to &6figure out why the heck your program isn't working&r.
university.dbstep.desc2: The &7db&r command will allow you to &6debug&r, so you can &6watch your program step by step&r.
university.dbstep.desc3: The &7help&r command will show you all the arguments you can use. &7db debug&r will enable debugging mode for all program slots. You can do &7db debug 0&r only to do the first slot, etc.
university.dbstep.desc4: When in debug mode, your program will wait. &7db step&r (or &7db s&r) will make the program &6go to the next step&r, and it will display which opcode it is on. This allows you to &6follow the path your program is taking&r through your tiles.
university.dbstep.desc5: &7db info&r will also display what tile it is on. &7db last&r will &6display the value&r of the last opcode that handles them.
university.dbstep.desc6: Finally, &7db resume&r will exit debugging mode, resuming normal function.
university.node.title: Avode the Node
university.node.subtitle: Make a Node
university.node.desc1: &bNodes&r can connect to your Processor to &6allow it access to blocks at a distance&r. Instead of needing to be adjacent to the Processor, it can be adjacent to a Node!
university.node.desc2: The Processor needs to have a &bNetwork Card&r installed. The higher tier one allows for a larger range.
university.node.desc3: Type the Processor command &7net setup [name]&r, replacing [name] with the name of your network, which can be anything.
university.node.desc4: Place down a &bNode&r somewhere in range, and set the channel to your network. Give your Node a unique name as well.
university.node.desc5: To connect Nodes to the Processor, rerun the setup command. You can do &7net info&r or &7net list&r to confirm that they are connected.
university.node.desc6: In the &6Programmer&r, all Side parameters allow you to input a Node name. Put the name of your Node here, and it will use that instead of the Processor.
university.programkeys.title: Sharing is Caring
university.programkeys.subtitle: Learn how to copy and paste programs
university.programkeys.desc1: In the Programmer, you can &6hold control and tap C&r to &bcopy your program&r as text. Specifically, as the contents of a json file.
university.programkeys.desc2: You can save this text anywhere, like a text file, or online to share it with others. You can also &bpaste programs&r into the Programmer by &6holding control and tapping V&r.
university.networkid.subtitle: Make a Network Identifier
university.networkid.desc1: The &bNetwork Identifier&r allows you to &6send information between separate networks&r.
university.networkid.desc2: On the destination network (that is, the network that the message is being sent to), sneak right-click a &bNetwork Identifier&r on its Processor.
university.networkid.desc3: Place the linked Identifier &6in the inventory&r of the origin network (that is, the network &osending&r the message). Note, this goes in the &cinventory&r, the slots on the right. It also needs an &bAdvanced Network Card&r.
university.networkid.desc4: In the programmer, use the &6Send Message&r operation. Name is the message name, IdSlot is the inventory slot with the linked Network Identifier, and Variable is the variable sent in the message. This program goes in the origin network.
university.networkid.desc5: Make a second program, and use the &6Message&r event. This one will start the program when a specific Message is received (set by the Name parameter). Single will make it only run once when it gets the message.
university.networkid.desc6: When the destination network receives a message, it triggers the Message event, outputting a string that matches the variable the message carries.
university.networkid.desc7: Now, you can't send items between networks, you &ccan only send information&r.
university.controlworkbench.title: Autocrafting
university.controlworkbench.subtitle: Make a Workbench
university.controlworkbench.desc1: The &bWorkbench&r allows you to &6automatically craft items with programs&r.
university.controlworkbench.desc2: Place the Station within range of a Network, and run &7net setup [name]&r again. This will connect the Station to the network.
university.controlworkbench.desc3: Use a &bCrafting Card&r and set up a recipe on the left. If it's a normal crafting recipe, put it in the top left 9 slots and click Update to save the recipe.
university.controlworkbench.desc4: Place this saved Recipe Card in the Workbench, and the network will now know how to craft that item.
university.controlworkbench.desc5: In the Programmer, filter to the category crafting. For &6Get Ingredients&r, &6Inv&r is the inventory to pull ingredient items from, &6CardInv&r is the inventory with the Crafting Cards (i.e., the Workbench), &6Item&r is the item to craft.
university.controlworkbench.desc6: For Slot1 and Slot2, set the &6minimum and maximum Processor inv slots&r it can store items in, which should &6match the amount of slots used in the recipe&r. For a 3x3 recipe, Slot2 must be 9 higher than Slot1 (0-8, etc.). When this is triggered, it will pull the ingredients into the corresponding slots in the Processor.
university.controlworkbench.desc7: Now, use the &6Push Multiple Items&r operation, and set Inv to be the Workbench. Set it to input &6through the top&r, as well. Set Slot1 and Slot2 to the same you did earlier. This will send the items from the Processor to the Workbench, ready to be crafted.
university.controlworkbench.desc8: Use a simple &6Fetch Items&r operation to &6pull from the bottom of the Workbench&r to craft the item. From there, you can do what you want with it.
university.controlcraftstation.title: Easy Autocraft Requesting
university.controlcraftstation.subtitle: Make a Crafting Station
university.controlcraftstation.desc1: The &bCrafting Station&r gives you an easy list of all the craftable items in the network.
university.controlcraftstation.desc2: Make a crafting program like before, but use the event &6Craft&r. This fires off when the craft is requested. You can leave Item blank, but set Inv to the Workbench.
university.controlcraftstation.desc3: In the Get Ingredients operation, set &6Item&r to the Function &6craftresult&r. This will let you use one program to craft any item with a Crafting Card.
university.controlcraftstation.desc4: After fetching the crafting result, you can add the &6Mark Craft Ok&r operation, give it the slot the item is in, and it will &6send the item to the Crafting Station&r that requested it!
university.dimlet.title: Custom Dimensions!
university.dimlet.subtitle: Make an Empty Dimlet
university.dimlet.desc1: &eRFTools Dimensions&r allows you to &6create custom dimensions&r with any combination of features!
university.dimlet.desc2: Do you want an infinite ocean of Milk? A peaceful forest, with floating orbs of Diamond?
university.dimlet.desc3: If you have the items and can afford the energy it takes to run, you can make it!
university.enscriber.title: &oMyst&rerious!
university.enscriber.subtitle: Make an Enscriber
university.enscriber.desc1: &bDimension Tabs&r are basically the item version of the custom dimension.
university.enscriber.desc2: The &bEnscriber&r is where they are created. Insert the &bEmpty Dimension Tab&r into it, and &6insert Dimlets&r according to how you want your dimension to be.
university.enscriber.desc3: You &6don't have to put any Dimlets in&r! Any features (biome, weather, etc.) that are not specified &care randomized&r. An entirely empty Dimension Tab is completely random and unpredictable!
university.enscriber.desc4: Once you're happy with your Dimlets, &6name the Tab&r at the bottom left and click &6Store&r to finalize it.
university.dimensionbuilder.title: Microverse
university.dimensionbuilder.subtitle: Make a Dimension Builder
university.dimensionbuilder.desc1: A &bRealized Dimension Tab&r is the finalized Tab, ready to be used.
university.dimensionbuilder.desc2: Insert it into a &bDimension Builder&r, and provide it with energy. You can see in the Tab's tooltip &6how much FE/t it needs&r. This depends on what the dimension is made of.
university.dimensionbuilder.desc3: If the Tab says &6Dimension ready!&r, you are good to go! &cMAKE SURE THE BUILDER IS CHUNKLOADED BEFORE ENTERING!&r
university.rftdmatter.title: Allons-y!
university.rftdmatter.subtitle: Make a way into the dimension
university.rftdmatter.desc1: To get to the dimension, you'll have to &6teleport in&r with a &bMatter Transmitter&r.
university.rftdmatter.desc2: Use the &bDialing Device&r to connect your Transmitter to the new dimension (which generates with a Matter Receiver), and click &6Dial&r!
university.rftdmatter.desc3: The dimension &cdoes not include a way back&r! You'll have to figure that out yourself!
university.researcher.title: Knawledge
university.researcher.subtitle: Make a Researcher
university.researcher.desc1: Dimensions are customized using &6Dimlets&r. But to create a Dimlet, you have to &6research&r it first.
university.researcher.desc2: Find &bLost Knowledge&r either in custom dimensions or as a rare drop from Endermen.
university.researcher.desc3: Put the Knowledge through a &bResearcher&r, and it will unlock a specific type of Dimlet to be created.
university.researcher.desc4: For example, researching a Legendary Lost Knowledge might give you the &6tag: ores&r dimlet!
university.digitdimlets.title: i++
university.digitdimlets.subtitle: Make a Digit Dimlet
university.digitdimlets.desc1: You &ccannot have two identical dimlets&r. This &6includes empty ones&r!
university.digitdimlets.desc2: &bDigit Dimlets&r do nothing except allow two otherwise identical Dimlets to exist separately.
university.digitdimlets.desc3: If a dimension already exists with the exact Dimlets you want, just stick in some Digit Dimlets as well!
university.activityprobe.title: While We're Away
university.activityprobe.subtitle: Make an Activity Probe
university.activityprobe.desc: The &bActivity Probe&r, when placed in a dimension, will &6prevent the dimension from draining power while no chunks are loaded&r.
university.rftstructs.title: Dimensional Dungeons
university.rftstructs.subtitle: ...or, well, structures
university.rftstructs.task: Look at a Dimensional Blank Block
university.rftstructs.desc1: Around your dimensions, you can &bfind small structures&r made of Dimensional Blocks.
university.rftstructs.desc2: Inside you can find a chest containing &6valuable loot&r, including various filled Dimlets and Lost Knowledge!
university.dimletworkbench.title: Dimlet Crafting
university.dimletworkbench.subtitle: Make a Dimlet Workbench and Knowledge Holder
university.dimletworkbench.desc1: Dimlets are crafted in the &bDimlet Workbench&r. Dimlet recipes are &chidden by default&r, unlocked only by &6researched Knowledge in an adjacent&r &bKnowledge Holder&r!
university.dimletworkbench.desc2: On the right is a list of Dimlets you can craft with your current knowledge. Each Dimlet's tooltip will show the required ingredients.
university.dimletworkbench.desc3: Generally, you will need an &6Empty Dimlet&r of the correct type, an &6Energy Module&r, a &6Memory Module&r, &6Dimensional Shards&r, and some unique items depending on the Dimlet.
university.dimletworkbench.desc4: Once you have all the ingredients, select the Dimlet by &ndouble clicking&r and click &6Create&r!
university.filleddimlets.title: Worldbuilding
university.filleddimlets.subtitle: Get a Filled Dimlet
university.filleddimlets.desc1: &bDimlets&r describe every part of a dimension. Some &6must be used together&r, however.
university.filleddimlets.desc2: A Block/Fluid/Biome Dimlet will only ensure that the block/fluid/biome exists &osomewhere&r in the dimension. To choose &ohow&r they're incorporated, you'll need to use it with a second Dimlet.
university.filleddimlets.desc3: For example, if you want to have tendrils of ores, you would need both the &6Tag Dimlet: forge:ores&r as well as the &6Feature Dimlet: Tendrils&r.
university.filleddimlets.desc4: If you want the dimension only to have Ocean biome, you have to use &6Biome Dimlet: Ocean&r and &6Biome Controller Dimlet: Single&r.
university.phasedfield.title: Backup Plan
university.phasedfield.subtitle: Make a Phased Field Generator
university.phasedfield.desc1: If you're in a dimension while it runs out of power, it causes &cinstant death&r! You won't be able to get back in until it's powered, either!
university.phasedfield.desc2: The &bPhased Field Generator&r uses its own internal charge to &6power the dimension around you&r.
university.phasedfield.desc3: With it, you're safe to rush in, get your stuff, and get back out. Don't stay too long!
university.dimessence.title: Did You Just Call Me &oBlob?&r
university.dimessence.subtitle: Get Dimensional Essence
university.dimessence.desc1: In certain custom dimensions (not all), you can find &6Blobs&r.
university.dimessence.desc2: Kill Blobs to get &bDimensional Essence&r, a resource used in certain recipes.
university.dimletingredients.title: Dimlet Ingredients
university.dimletingredients.subtitle: Get the Dimlet ingredients
university.dimletingredients.desc1: The simplest Dimlets, like &6Biome: Forest&r and &6Block: Stone&r can be crafted from the start.
university.dimletingredients.desc2: However, more advanced Dimlets like &6Iron Ore&r, need ingredients that can only be found in custom dimensions.
university.dimletingredients.desc3: That means, to make a more advanced dimension you have to &6explore lesser ones first&r!
university.absorbers.title: schlop schlop schlop schlop
university.absorbers.subtitle: Make an Absorber
university.absorbers.desc1: Dimlets of certain types (block, biome, etc.) require a filled &bAbsorber&r of the same type to be crafted.
university.absorbers.desc2: For instance, a &6Glowstone Block Dimlet&r needs a Block Absorber that's &6full of Glowstone&r.
university.absorbers.desc3: To fill an Absorber, &6place it on top of the thing you want it to absorb&r. It will destroy the block below, and spread out searching for more.
university.absorbers.desc4: For Biome and Structure Absorbers, simply place it inside the biome or structure and wait.
university.absorbers.desc5: Once it's done absorbing, &6mine it&r to pick it up.
university.absorbers.desc6: Optionally, you can &6put it in a Researcher&r to get Lost Knowledge of what was absorbed!
university.codexarcana.subtitle: Get the Codex Arcana
university.codexarcana.desc1: The &bCodex Arcana&r is &eMana and Artifice&r's guide book.
university.codexarcana.desc2: It is &cnot craftable&r; you have to &6find it in structures&r or &6buy it from a villager&r.
university.codexarcana.desc3: You can change any villager into a Spellmonger by &6trapping it near a Runeforge&r and buy it there.
university.codexarcana.desc4: There are 9 chapters along the right, and 5 option buttons along the bottom. These let you change how the GUI looks and where it is, and some other options.
university.codexarcana.desc5: &6Pages unlock as you progress through the mod.&r You can only see what you can make.
university.codexarcana.desc6: Some things can be &6pinned&r, so you can see them outside of the book!
university.occulus.title: Index
university.occulus.subtitle: Make the Occulus
university.occulus.desc1: The &bOcculus&r helps &6guide you through the mod&r.
university.occulus.desc2: The mod has a &6tier system&r. You start at tier 1, and grow in tier as you progress, which unlocks more things.
university.occulus.desc3: The first page of the Occulus &6shows you how to progress to the next tier&r.
university.occulus.desc4: Along the left are several tabs. The first is explained above, the second and third are explained in the quests to the right.
university.occulus.desc5: The other tabs are essentially &6a list of what is unlocked at each tier&r.
university.affinity.title: Affinity, Faction, and Power
university.affinity.subtitle: Learn about the Affinity / Faction / Power tab
university.affinity.desc1: The second tab shows you &6information about yourself. Firstly: Faction.
university.affinity.desc2: At some point in the mod, you will have to join a &bFaction&r. This choice will &6unlock certain items magics&r, and &cblock others&r.
university.affinity.desc3: Additionally, joining a faction will &6make its mobs friendly&r, but &cmake other faction mobs hostile&r!
university.affinity.desc4: Every spell has a certain elemental &bAffinity&r. There are six main affinities:
university.affinity.desc5:
• Air
• Earth
• Water
• Fire
• Ender
• Arcane
university.affinity.desc6: As you cast spells of an element, you gain affinity with it. The &6higher your affinity, the less Mana it takes to cast&r.
university.affinity.desc7: However, each element has an opposite. Having affinity with one element makes it &cmore expensive to cast spells of the opposing element&r.
university.affinity.desc8:
Air opposed Earth.
Water opposes Fire.
Arcane opposes Ender.
university.affinity.desc9: This page also shows your current &6Eldrin Wellspring Energy&r of each affinity.
university.beltoflocks.subtitle: Make a Belt of Locks
university.beltoflocks.desc: While wearing the &bBelt of Locks&r, your &6affinities will be locked&r.
university.sorcery.title: Sorcery
university.sorcery.subtitle: Learn about the Sorcery tab
university.sorcery.desc1: The &bSorcery&r tab is basically just a &6list of spell parts&r, and &6what tier&r they're unlocked in.
university.sorcery.desc2: However, each part also has a &6progress bar&r. The more you use spells with that part, the more it progresses.
university.sorcery.desc3: Once the bar is completely full, that spell becomes &6rote&r. Rote spells are basically memorized, used so much they've become second nature.
university.sorcery.desc4: This is mostly important for the &6Book of Rote&r, which has a quest elsewhere.
university.sorcery.desc5: Additionally, spells that require a &6faction&r will have that faction's icon in the corner.
university.spellscribing.title: Spellscribing
university.spellscribing.subtitle: Make and use the Inscription Table
university.spellscribing.desc1: Before you can make a spell, you have to say what you want it to do.
university.spellscribing.desc2: Place the &bInscription Table&r, and give it some &bArcanist's Ink&r, Paper, and &bArcane Ash&r. Stock up on these, you'll need a lot.
university.spellscribing.desc3: There are three rows. The top row is dedicated to the spell's &6Shape&r, basically what it targets.
university.spellscribing.desc4: At tier 1, you can only aim at yourself or the block you click on, but more shapes are unlocked as you progress. Each is described in the &6Codex Arcana&r.
university.spellscribing.desc5: The second row is for the spell's &6Effect&r, what the spell actually does.
university.spellscribing.desc6: There is a huge range of spell effects. Each one is described in the book.
university.spellscribing.desc7: The third row is for &6Modifiers&r, though &cnone are unlocked at Tier 1&r.
university.spellscribing.desc8: You can have up to three modifiers. They will &6add arrow buttons to the upper rows&r, so you can increase/decrease the range, damage, etc of those parts.
university.spellscribing.desc9: At the top right, you can see the spell's &6complexity&r and the max allowed (which increases by Tier). It will also display the spell's &6mana cost&r.
university.spellscribing.desc10: Under that, you can see how much Ink, Paper, and Ash it will take to inscribe. If all are in the Table, click the arrow at the top to make the Spell Recipe.
university.spellscribing.desc11: Under &othat&r, you can see the &6Required Reagents&r. That is, &6what items are required to complete the spell&r.
university.spellscribing.desc12: Due to a &cmod incompatibility&r, you can't actually see these in the Inscription Table. You can still see these by &6using the Spell Recipe&r after creating it, though.
university.manarituals.title: Rituals
university.manarituals.subtitle: Learn how to do rituals
university.manarituals.desc1: &6Rituals&r provide more powerful or more permanent effects than spells.
university.manarituals.desc2: Each ritual has a certain recipe, see its page in the Codex Arcana. You can &6pin&r this recipe so you can see it while not in the book. Dismiss it from your inventory.
university.manarituals.desc3: Use &bWizard Chalk&r on the ground, matching the pattern of the ritual recipe. Each X is somewhere you need to place Chalk.
university.manarituals.desc4: Once the pattern has been drawn on the ground, use &bPurified Vinteum Dust&r on the center mark. If the pattern matches a ritual, it will change color and show you where you need to place items.
university.manarituals.desc5: Right-click the Chalk to place the item on it. You don't have to be holding the item in your hand, you just have to have it.
university.manarituals.desc6: Use the Dust on the center again to begin the ritual. Some rituals require the use of the &6Manaweaver's Wand&r; see its quest to see how to use that.
university.practpouch.title: Quick Rituals
university.practpouch.subtitle: Make a Practitioner's Pouch
university.practpouch.desc1: The &bPractitioner's Pouch&r allows you to &6quickly cast a ritual without placing the Chalk circle&r. You can have up to 8 Rituals per Pouch.
university.practpouch.desc2: Sneak right-click the Practitioner's Pouch on the center Chalk of a ritual circle that is ready to go. This will save that ritual to the Pouch.
university.practpouch.desc3: Put Ritual Chalk and any other items the ritual needs into the Practitioner's Pouch, then &6use it on the ground to cast the ritual&r. The ground must have room to place the Chalk circle.
university.pouchpatch.title: Pouch Patches
university.pouchpatch.subtitle: Make a Pouch patch
university.pouchpatch.desc1: &bPatches&r are basically upgrades you can apply to the &6Practitioner's Pouch&r. You can see what each does in the &6Codex Arcana&r.
university.pouchpatch.desc2: To apply the patch, combine it onto the Pouch on the &6Runic Anvil&r with a &6Sorcerous Sewing Kit&r.
university.odinaxe.subtitle: Receive the Allfather's Axe
university.odinaxe.desc1: &6The Allfather&r is the first of the mod's boss fights, and is summoned using the &6Ritual of Odin's Call&r. &cPrepare yourself before summoning him.&r
university.odinaxe.desc2: When defeated, the Allfather will grant you the &bAllfather's Axe&r. This Axe deals massive damage, can be swung incredibly quickly, has infinite durability, and &6can be thrown&r, returning afterwards.
university.spellcrafting.title: Spellcrafting
university.spellcrafting.subtitle: Make a spell
university.spellcrafting.desc1: Open your &bSpell Recipe&r and &6collect everything it says you will need&r.
university.spellcrafting.desc2: On the ground, place chalk according to the &6Ritual of Arcana&r, and use Purified Vinteum Dust on the center chalk.
university.spellcrafting.desc3: Place the &6Spell Recipe into the center Chalk&r. Place the spell's &6reagents where the Chalk says&r.
university.spellcrafting.desc4: Use the Dust again to begin the ritual. Draw the Patterns it shows using the &6Manaweaver's Wand&r (or any other method you have).
university.spellcrafting.desc5: Repeat as needed, and the ritual will end, finishing the &bSpell&r! Use it to &6choose its icon and name&r, then hit escape to close the menu.
university.spellcrafting.desc6: Right-click the spell to cast it!
university.magictips.title: Magic Tips
university.magictips.subtitle: Some misc stuff about magic
university.magictips.desc1: Your &6max mana&r is based on your &6magic level&r, which is &6increased by casting spells&r.
university.magictips.desc2: The mana GUI (which &6we recommend setting to only be visible while holding magic items&r, in the Codex Arcana) shows your current Mana, the Mana cost of your held spell, and your progress towards the next magic level.
university.magictips.desc3: Your magic level is capped, with the cap increasing for each Tier. The higher your Tier, the higher your magic level can reach.
university.spellbook.subtitle: Make a Spell Book
university.spellbook.desc1: The &bSpell Book&r can &6hold 38 spells&r, and allows you to &6cast 8 of them&r (not at the same time, obviously).
university.spellbook.desc2: Hold control and right-click it to open its GUI. The slots on the right are for storage, and the slots on the left are for quick-casting.
university.spellbook.desc3: Whole holding the Book, hold down &6Z&r to show all spells in the quick-cast slots. Hover over one, then release Z to select it.
university.spellbook.desc4: Right-click the Spell Book to cast the currently selected spell.
university.studydesk.subtitle: Make a Study Desk
university.studydesk.desc1: The &bStudy Desk&r is where you can &6increase your rote knowledge of spell parts&r.
university.studydesk.desc2: You do this by inserting a &6Torn Journal Fragment&r or &6Arcane Thesis&r, then clicking the arrow button (if you have the experience to afford it).
university.studydesk.desc3: A Journal Fragment will boost that spell part's rote by 25%%, while a Thesis will jump straight to 100%%.
university.arcanaaltar.title: No More Drawing on the Dirt For Me, Thanks
university.arcanaaltar.subtitle: Make an Altar of Arcana
university.arcanaaltar.desc1: The &bAltar of Arcana&r is essentially a single block that functions like the Ritual of Arcana: it &6crafts Spells&r.
university.arcanaaltar.desc2: Place a Spell Recipe in the top, and either a &6Vellum, Staff, Wand, or Bangle&r below.
university.arcanaaltar.desc3: Place the ingredients in a nearby inventory, and click the arrow button to begin.
university.arcanaaltar.desc4: Once it has taken all the ingredients, give it the Manaweave Patterns it asks for. This will create the Spell!
university.staveswands.title: For the Distinguished Wizard
university.staveswands.subtitle: Make a Staff, Wand, or Bangle
university.staveswands.desc1: &bStaves, Wands, and Bangles&r are basically just &6fancy-looking&r single-spell casting items and not much else.
university.staveswands.desc2: They can be found in dungeons, but those have &6limited uses&r.
university.staveswands.desc3: To set the spell, combine it with the Spell item in the &6Manaweaving Table&r. Don't forget to use the Manaweaver's Wand! Check JEI or the book.
university.staffpilgrim.subtitle: Make the Staff of the Pilgrim
university.staffpilgrim.desc: When held in the offhand, the &bStaff of the Pilgrim&r makes you more agile.
university.factions.title: Factions
university.factions.subtitle: Learn about factions
university.factions.desc1: At the end of tier 2, you will have to join one of three &bfactions&r. You can only choose one, and you &ccannot undo&r this decision.
university.factions.desc2: Joining a faction &cwill make every other factions' mobs hostile to you&r!
university.factions.desc3: Each faction unlocks &6certain spells and unique items&r, and some have other major gameplay changes.
university.factions.desc4: We've marked each faction item and spell with a tooltip, so you can make an informed decision. The &6quests below&r explain each item, and the &6quest on the left&r shows the spells.
university.factions.desc5: Each faction has a specific &6ritual&r you must do to join them. For more details, consult the &6Codex Arcana&r.
university.factions.demon.1: &cThe Demons of the Nether&r have a focus on &6offense&r.
university.factions.demon.2: Rather than Mana, they use &6Brimstone&r. Brimstone recharges faster in hot biomes, and slower in cold ones.
university.factions.demon.3: Brimstone allows for &6higher limits&r for Damage, Radius, and Range, and have a &6faster spell cooldown&r.
university.factions.demon.4: If you run out of Brimstone, you can continue to cast &cat the cost of health&r. This does not apply to passive effects.
university.factions.faerie.1: &aThe Faerie Courts&r have a focus on &6subterfuge and trickery&r.
university.factions.faerie.2: Rather than Mana, they have one of two resources. &6Summer Fire&r makes spells more &6powerful during the day&r and &cweaker at night&r, while &6Winter Ice&r does the opposite.
university.factions.faerie.3: Use the &6Ritual of Shifting Seasons&r to swap between which resources is used.
university.factions.council.1: &3The Ancient Council of Wizards&r have a focus on &6defense and Mana manipulation&r.
university.factions.council.2: While the Council doesn't have very unique mechanics, it has very good items and spells!
university.factions.undead.1: &7The Undead&r have a focus on &6unrelenting endurance and spirit magic&r.
university.factions.undead.2: Rather than Mana, they have &6Souls&r. Souls &cdo not regenerate&r. They can only be &6gathered by killing&r, or performing certain rituals.
university.factions.undead.3: As a trade off, however, &6the Soul pool is significantly larger than any Mana pool&r would be.
university.factions.undead.4: Undead &cburn in sunlight&r but can &6see and breathe underwater&r. Burning can be mitigated by a helmet, though it will be damaged.
university.factions.undead.5: Casting Night Vision will make the &6duration infinite&r. Casting again will disable.
university.factionspells.title: Faction Spells
university.factionspells.subtitle: A list of each faction's unique spells
university.factionspells.desc: Here, you can see a list of &beach faction's unique spells&r, so you can better decide which faction you want to join.
university.bossarenas.title: Boss Arenas
university.bossarenas.subtitle: Find a Boss Arena
university.bossarenas.desc1: Every faction has &6two unique structures&r. One is smaller, one is larger. The larger is a &bBoss Arena&r.
university.bossarenas.desc2: Boss Arenas generally have quite a bit to them, &6if you explore&r. Check every nook and cranny!
university.bossarenas.desc3: You can find Boss Arenas by first &6purchasing the structure's Thaumaturgic Link from the Broker&r, and then converting it to a Thaumaturgic Compass in the &6Ritual of Locating&r.
university.mnabosses.title: Regicide
university.mnabosses.subtitle: Kill the four faction bosses
university.mnabosses.desc1: Once you've actually &oreached&r the Boss Arena, you might expect to see a boss to fight. There is not. They &6have to be summoned&r.
university.mnabosses.desc2: To summon the bosses, &bperform that faction's joining ritual&r in the structure.
university.mnabosses.desc3: Each boss fight is unique, and &6has its own mechanics&r. Make sure you're prepared!
university.factionhorns.title: Gjallarhorn
university.factionhorns.subtitle: Make a Faction Horn
university.factionhorns.desc1: &bFaction Horns&r will &6summon a group of members of that faction&r to help in battle.
university.factionhorns.desc2: It only lasts for a relatively short duration, and has a &6very very long cooldown&r.
university.factionhorns.desc3: Obviously, you can only use the Horn of your own faction.
university.ironbell.title: Buyer's Remorse
university.ironbell.subtitle: Use the Ritual of the Iron Bell
university.ironbell.desc1: Did you join the Demons of the Nether and then realize that, wait a second, &oPvE is awful&r?
university.ironbell.desc2: Good news! The &bRitual of the Iron Bell&r allows you to &6trade for relics from other factions&r!
university.ironbell.desc3: It will summon &6The Broker&r, a mysterious entity who sells relics in return for other relics and &6Marks&r.
university.ironbell.desc4: Each faction has soldiers that randomly spawn around the world. Kill them to pick up Marks of that faction.
university.ironbell.desc5: The trades it provides are &6random&r, changed every time it is summoned. It will only stick around for about half a day, though you can dispel him early by attacking him.
university.ironbell.desc6: &cBe warned&r: factions do not like when other people use their things. Marks &oare&r basically dog tags, after all. Using another faction's relic can start a &6raid&r, spawning waves of that faction's soldiers near your location.
university.eldrinbracelet.title: Eldrin Academy
university.eldrinbracelet.subtitle: Make the Bracelet of Eldrin Power
university.eldrinbracelet.desc1: The &bBracelet of Eldrin Power&r allows you to &6draw power from residual magic and nearby Eldrin Wellsprings&r.
university.eldrinbracelet.desc2: Risidual Magic is left behind by spells, rituals, and manaweaves, and deteriorates over time.
university.eldrinsight.subtitle: Make the Eldrin Sight Unguent
university.eldrinsight.desc1: The &bEldrin Sight Unguent&r allows you to locate Eldrin Wellsprings, and are available at an earlier tier than &6Wellspring Sight Unguent&r.
university.eldrinsight.desc2: It also lets you see through "veils and illusions created by other mages."
university.emberglow.subtitle: Make the Emberglow Bracelet
university.emberglow.desc1: The &bEmberglow Bracelet&r will &6fully negate damage from fire and lava&r.
university.emberglow.desc2: It &cdoes not last forever&r and will have to be recharged, though it lasts for a fairly long time.
university.trickery.title: Here's a Little Lesson in Trickery
university.trickery.subtitle: Make the Bracelet of Trickery
university.trickery.desc1: The &bBracelet of Tricker&r will give you certain buffs while sneaking.
university.trickery.desc2: It will &6make you invisible&r (including armor and held items), and punching with an empty hand will &6send your target flying&r.
university.hellfirestaff.title: Hellfire! Dark Fire!
university.hellfirestaff.subtitle: Make the Hellfire Staff
university.hellfirestaff.desc1: The &bHellfire Staff&r works like regular Staves, and &6makes any fire-based spells significantly more powerful&r.
university.hellfirestaff.desc2: Hellfire is much more powerful, &6bypassing fire resistance&r.
university.arcanecrown.subtitle: Make the Arcane Crown
university.arcanecrown.desc: The &bArcane Crown&r will &6decrease the mana cost of spells&r, &6increase your mana pool&r, and &6sometimes dispel harmful effects&r.
university.spectralelytra.subtitle: Make the Spectral Elytra
university.spectralelytra.desc1: The &bSpectral Elytra&r will &6boost you forward when flying&r. You can sneak to stop.
university.coffin.subtitle: Make a Coffin
university.coffin.desc1: Players in the Undead faction can sleep in a &bCoffin&r to &6restore some soul power&r.
university.coffin.desc2: Sleeping again too soon will have diminishing returns.
university.brittlebone.subtitle: Make a Ring of Brittle Bone
university.brittlebone.desc: The &bRing of Brittle Bone&r allows Undead players to &6regain more soul from killing&r.
university.manaweaverswand.title: Manaweaving
university.manaweaverswand.subtitle: Make a Manaweaver's Wand
university.manaweaverswand.desc2: Manaweaving is the art of drawing &6Manaweaving Patterns&r in the air, which are used in certain rituals and recipes. This is done by literally &6drawing the shape in the air&r.
university.manaweaverswand.desc3: You can find a list of Manaweave Patterns in the &6Occulus&r. Hold right-click with the Wand then draw the pattern to cast it, and it will hover in the air.
university.manaweaverswand.desc4: If something nearby can use that Pattern, it will be absorbed.
university.manaweaverswand.desc5: The &6Improvised and Vinteum Wands&r have durability, while the &6Chimerite&r Wand has infinite uses.
university.manacache.title: Manaweave Caches
university.manacache.subtitle: Find a Manaweave Cache
university.manacache.desc1: &bManaweave Caches&r are structures that can be found around the world. They're essentially &6small manaweaving puzzles&r with a reward inside.
university.manacache.desc2: Simply walk up to it, &6give it the 3 Manaweave patterns it wants&r, and it'll open!
university.manacache.desc3: Inside can either be a &6long-lasting buff&r or an &6inventory with items&r.
university.manaweavebottle.title: Manaweave in a Bottle
university.manaweavebottle.subtitle: Collect Manaweave in a Bottle
university.manaweavebottle.desc1: Manaweave Patterns... aren't the easiest thing to draw. You don't really want to be standing there for an hour trying to draw a triangle when you just want to make a spell.
university.manaweavebottle.desc2: If you &6use a Bottle on a Manaweave Pattern&r, you will collect it as a &bManaweave in a Bottle&r!
university.manaweavebottle.desc3: These can be stored and then &6thrown&r on the ground at any time to quickly summon the Pattern again.
university.manaweaveprojector.subtitle: Make the Manaweave Projector
university.manaweaveprojector.desc1: The &bManaweave Projector&r will draw Mana from nearby players and, when activated, it will &6draw a Pattern above them&r.
university.manaweaveprojector.desc2: By default, it will only draw the triangle pattern. To change the pattern, use &bManaweaving Patterns&r, which you buy from the Manaweaver villager (who uses the Manaweaving Altar as its workstation).
university.manaweaveprojector.desc3: Theoretically, you could have one of each Pattern and then &6automatically collect them with Bottles&r.
university.cantrips.title: Cantrips
university.cantrips.subtitle: Learn about cantrips
university.cantrips.desc1: &bCantrips&r are spells that cost nothing, and are made by &6quickly drawing two Manaweave Patterns in succession&r.
university.cantrips.desc2: Control right-click the Manaweaver's Wand to open the cantrip gui. There, you will see up to 8 cantrips, based on your Tier.
university.cantrips.desc3: You can &6set the shape combination&r for each, and then quickly drawing those shapes will cast the cantrip.
university.grimoire.subtitle: Get the Grimoire
university.grimoire.desc1: The &bGrimoire&r is basically the &6Spell Book equivalent of an Ender Chest&r.
university.grimoire.desc2: Any spell you put in a Grimoire is available in any Grimoire you use!
university.manaweavingaltar.subtitle: Make the Manaweaving Altar
university.manaweavingaltar.desc1: The &bManaweaving Altar&r is used to &6craft things using items and Patterns&r.
university.manaweavingaltar.desc2: Place the item ingredients into the Altar, and then &6cast the Manaweave Patterns near the Altar&r.
university.manaweavingaltar.desc3: You can see the Patterns along the rim of the Altar. Use the Wand on the Altar to remove the most recent Pattern, if you did the wrong one (which you will, often).
university.manaweavingaltar.desc4: Some recipes require you be a certain tier. There's not really a way to show that in quests, but the item itself says what tier it needs.
university.crystalmemories.subtitle: Make a Crystal of Memories
university.crystalmemories.desc1: The &bCrystal of Memories&r &6stores experience&r, up to 20,000 points!
university.crystalmemories.desc2: Sneak right-click it to change between inserting and extracting, and hold right-click to use.
university.manacrysfrag.title: Mana Crystal Fragment
university.manacrysfrag.subtitle: Make the Mana Crystal Fragment
university.manacrysfrag.desc1: The &bMana Crystal Fragment&r (and the &bMana Gems&r) &6store Mana&r.
university.manacrysfrag.desc2: Sneak right-click it to change between inserting and extracting, and hold right-click to use.
university.wardingcandle.subtitle: Make the Warding Candle
university.wardingcandle.desc: The &bWarding Candle&r, while lit, will &6prevent spawns in a 32 block radius cube&r around it.
university.bookofrote.title: The Best Thing
university.bookofrote.subtitle: Make the Book of Rote
university.bookofrote.desc1: The &bBook of Rote&r allows you to &6combine rote spell parts on the fly&r to make spells.
university.bookofrote.desc2: These spells are identical to normal spells, but you don't have to go through the lengthy process of crafting them. You &6simply combine the parts&r, and that's it!
university.bookofrote.desc3: Rote Modifiers don't take up any slot, they simply provide the arrow buttons to all spell parts.
university.bookofrote.desc4: Rote spells also have &66 slots&r, so you can have &6up to 5 components&r taking into account the shape.
university.bookofrote.desc5: You still have room for 8 spells, and it controls the same as a Spell Book.
university.slipstream.title: Uppies
university.slipstream.subtitle: Make a Slipstream Generator
university.slipstream.desc1: While standing within &650 blocks&r of where a &bSlipstream Generator&r is aiming, you can move along its path by looking at or away from it.
university.slipstream.desc2: That is, if you're above one that's aimed up, looking up sends you up and looking down sends you down.
university.slipstream.desc3: The steeper you look, the faster you move. You can sneak midair to hover where you are.
university.slipstream.desc4: You can stack Generators to increase their range.
university.witherguard.title: Was That Supposed to Hurt?
university.witherguard.subtitle: Make the Bracelet of Antidote and Witherguard Amulet
university.witherguard.desc: The &bBracelet of Antidote&r will &6nullify poison&r, and the &bWitherguard Amulet&r will &6nullify withering&r.
university.amuletward.subtitle: Make the Warding Amulet
university.amuletward.desc: The &bWarding Amulet&r will &6reduce incoming magic damage by 20%%&r. It also makes the spell shape &6Bound Shield&r free to maintain.
university.battlemage.subtitle: Make the Amulet of the Battlemage
university.battlemage.desc1: While wearing the &bAmulet of the Battlemage&r, your &6spell damage is increased by 30%% while holding a sword in your other hand&r.
university.battlemage.desc2: Additionally, your &6melee damage is increased the lower your mana is&r.
university.prismaticamulet.subtitle: Make the Prismatic Amulet
university.prismaticamulet.desc: The &bPrismatic Amulet&r boosts the Projectile spell, making it &6shoot 3 projectiles instead of 1&r.
university.minersrings.title: Miner's Rings
university.minersrings.subtitle: Make the various miner Rings
university.minersrings.desc1: The &6Break&r spell, by default, is only &6equivalent to a Stone Pickaxe&r. The &bBreak Rings&r &6increase its mining level&r to be like either Iron or Diamond.
university.minersrings.desc2: The &bRings of Fortune/Silk&r will &6apply Fortune or Silk Touch&r to the Break spell. You can enchant Fortune Rings to increase their benefits further.
university.minersrings.desc3: &bCollector's Rings&r will &6teleport drops to your inventory&r when you use the Break spell.
university.enderguard.subtitle: Make the Enderguard Amulet
university.enderguard.desc: The &bEnderguard Amulet&r will &6teleport exploding creepers away from you&r.
university.magearmor.title: Mage Armor
university.magearmor.subtitle: Make a set of Mage armor
university.magearmor.desc1: When you wear the full set of &bMage armor&r, it will &6boost your max mana and mana regen&r.
university.magearmor.desc2: It will also &6repair itself&r by draining Mana Crystal Fragments in your inventory.
university.rainbottle.title: If I Could Make Rain Last Forever
university.rainbottle.subtitle: Make a Raincloud in a Bottle
university.rainbottle.desc: The &bRaincloud in a Bottle&r can be used to place a Raincloud, which &6speeds up crop growth&r below itself.
university.animusdust.subtitle: Make Animus Dust
university.animusdust.desc1: &bAnimus Dust&r can be used to &6bring a block to life&r temporarily, similar to casting the Animus spell.
university.animusdust.desc2: It will hop around and &6attack nearby monsters&r before the life fades away.
university.animusdust.desc3: Additionally, it can &6create Animated Constructs&r if used on an Armor Stand with construct parts attached.
university.feathercharms.title: Charms of a Feather
university.feathercharms.subtitle: Make any Feather Charm
university.feathercharms.desc1: &bFeather Charms&r are magical items that are &6triggered by certain conditions&r, and work anywhere in your inventory. Upon triggering, the item is &cbroken&r.
university.feathercharms.desc2: &bCoalfeather&r puts you out if you're on fire, and hardens lava.
university.feathercharms.desc4: &bBonefeather&r protects you from lethal fall damage.
university.feathercharms.desc5: &bEnderfeather&r teleports you to your bed. Unlike the others, this one must be right-clicked to trigger.
university.contingency.title: Prep Time
university.contingency.subtitle: Make a Contingent Charm
university.contingency.desc1: &bContingent Charms&r will &6automatically cast a spell when certain conditions are met&r.
university.contingency.desc2: For example, the Damage Charm will cast its spell when you take damage, while the Low Health Charm will trigger when you reach low health.
university.contingency.desc3: Contingent Charms will &conly trigger when worn&r in their Curio slot. After the spell is triggered, it will be removed from the Charm and have to be reapplied.
university.exigent.title: Exigent Charms
university.exigent.subtitle: Make an Exigent Charm
university.exigent.desc1: &bExigent Charms&r work like Contingent Charms, but can have &6multiple charges&r.
university.exigent.desc2: To add a charge, simply run it through the Transcription Table another time.
university.sewingkit.subtitle: Make a Sorcerous Sewing Kit
university.sewingkit.desc1: The &bSorcerous Sewing Kit&r is required to &6repair Mage armor&r.
university.sewingkit.desc2: Place the armor on the &6Runic Anvil&r, then &6Infused Silk&r on top. Then, use the Sewing Kit on the Anvil to repair the armor.
university.manacrystal.subtitle: Make a Mana Crystal
university.manacrystal.desc1: Standing near a &bMana Crystal&r will &6rapidly refill your Mana&r.
university.manacrystal.desc2: Additionally, &6Pedestals&r can be placed within 8 blocks, and &6any item inserted will fill with Mana&r.
university.manacrystal.desc3: A single Mana Crystal can charge multiple Pedestals.
university.eldritchorb.subtitle: Make the Eldritch Orb
university.eldritchorb.desc1: The &bEldritch Orb&r will &6automatically damage hostile mobs&r.
university.eldritchorb.desc2: It doesn't do much damage, but you can &6enchant it&r.
university.magicbroom.title: Flightless Broomstick
university.magicbroom.subtitle: Make the Magic Broom
university.magicbroom.desc1: Place the &bMagic Broom&r on an inventory, and it will &6pick up dropped items&r nearby.
university.magicbroom.desc2: Sneak right-click it to pick it back up.
university.vortexbroom.title: The Quicker Picker Upper
university.vortexbroom.subtitle: Make the Vortex Broom
university.vortexbroom.desc: The &bVortex Broom&r does the same, but also &6pulls nearby items towards it&r to increase its range.
university.elementalsentries.title: Elemental Sentries
university.elementalsentries.subtitle: Make an Elemental Sentry
university.elementalsentries.desc1: &bElemental Sentries&r are stationary guardians that exist for each of the main elements, and shoot an elemental bolt at their target.
university.elementalsentries.desc2.1: Sentries must be powered by Eldrin Power, supplied by an
university.elementalsentries.desc3: Each affinity has its own quirks.
university.elementalsentries.desc5: &6Ender&r - fire slowly, teleports the target 10 blocks away.
university.elementalsentries.desc6: &6Water&r - fire slowly and weakly, applies Slowness.
university.elementalsentries.desc7: &6Wind&r - fires with medium speed, applies Levitation.
university.elementalsentries.desc8: &6Earth&r - fires very quickly, deals low physical damage.
university.elementalsentries.desc9: &6Fire&r - Fires very quickly, deals low fire damage.
university.elementalsentries.desc10: A &6Seer Stone&r can be placed adjacent to the Sentry to filter what it attacks. This is rather complex, so check its Codex Arcana page for details.
university.bubbleboat.title: Hamster Ball
university.bubbleboat.subtitle: Make a Bubble Boat
university.bubbleboat.desc1: The &bBubble Boat&r is basically a &6faster, more controllable boat&r.
university.bubbleboat.desc2: If you deploy it underwater, it will &6very quickly take you to the surface&r.
university.brimstonecharm.subtitle: Make the Brimstone Charm
university.brimstonecharm.desc1: The &bBrimstone Charm&r is used to &6greatly increase the speed the Runeforge works at&r.
university.brimstonecharm.desc2: It can also be used to make the &6Brimstone Boat&r, which works like the Bubble Boat but works on Lava.
university.transitorytunnel.title: Portable Hole
university.transitorytunnel.subtitle: Make the Transitory Tunnel
university.transitorytunnel.desc: The &bTransitory Tunnel&r can be used to &6create a temporary tunnel through blocks&r, which will fill back up after some time.
university.runeforge.subtitle: Make the Runeforge
university.runeforge.desc1: The &bRuneforge&r is basically a &6free-burning furnace&r that is also &6required for certain recipes&r.
university.runeforge.desc2: Any &6Campfire recipes are twice as fast&r, but &cFurnace/Blast Furnace recipes are twice as slow&r.
university.runeforge.desc3: It can accept up to 16 items at a time, but is not faster for it.
university.runeforge.desc4: Simply right-click to insert or extract items; the Runeforge has no GUI.
university.runedoubling.title: Free Ore Doubling
university.runedoubling.subtitle: Learn how to double ores in the Runeforge
university.runedoubling.desc1: Directly touching either side of the Runeforge, place two &bPedestals&r and then place &bRed&r, &bYellow&r, or &bOrange Chimerite Crystals&r on them, and the Runeforge will &6double ores&r.
university.runedoubling.desc2: This can be done as often as you like, but remember that the Runeforge is still really really slow.
university.runescribing.title: Runescribing
university.runescribing.subtitle: Make a Runescribing setup
university.runescribing.desc1: &6Runes&r are special items that are used in certain crafting recipes. They themselves have a very unique crafting mechanic.
university.runescribing.desc2: Place the &bRunescribing Table&r, then place inside it a &bRunesmith's Hammer&r and &bChisel&r, as well as a blank &bRune Pattern&r.
university.runescribing.desc3: On the left, you will see a pattern of dots. You can &6click between the dots to form a line&r connecting them.
university.runescribing.desc4: Each Rune Pattern has its own shape you have to draw in this way. It is suggested to &6pin the recipe&r using the book.
university.runescribing.desc5: If you make a &cmistake&r, you can &6spend Clay and XP&r to undo it. Do so by simply clicking the bit you want to remove.
university.runescribing.desc6: Once the pattern has been drawn exactly, it will become a &bRune Pattern&r of that rune.
university.runescribing.desc7: A Pattern one line from being completed:
university.runerecipe.title: Runscribing Recipes
university.runerecipe.subtitle: Buy a Runescribing Recipe
university.runerecipe.desc1: You can buy &bRunescribing Recipes&r for every Rune Pattern from the Ritualist villager (whose workstation is the Runescribing Table).
university.runerecipe.desc2: You can place the Recipe in the top right slot of the Runescribing Table to &6see the pattern recipe&r.
university.runerecipe.desc3: Given that &6you can see recipes that were pinned in the Codex Arcana&r, these aren't super useful.
university.runesmithing.title: Runesmithing
university.runesmithing.subtitle: Smith a Rune
university.runesmithing.desc1: To actually make the Rune, place down a &bRunic Anvil&r, then place the Rune Pattern on it.
university.runesmithing.desc2: Then, place the item that that Pattern needs (generally either a &bSuperheated Vinteum Ingot&r or &bSuperheated Purified Vinteum Ingot&r). If the recipe is valid, it will &6glow with a magic circle&r.
university.runesmithing.desc3: Use the &bRunesmith's Hammer&r on it a few times (check the recipe), and eventually it will turn into the finished &bRune&r.
university.runeritual.title: Reusable Rituals
university.runeritual.subtitle: Make some Rune: Ritual (Metal)...s
university.runeritual.desc1: The &bRune: Ritual (Metal)&r can be &6used in place of Ritual Chalk&r, and it will &6not disappear when used&r.
university.runeritual.desc2: As a consequence, it &ccannot be used with the Ritual Kit&r.
university.runeenchants.title: Runic Enchantments
university.runeenchants.subtitle: Learn how to enchant with Runes
university.runeenchants.desc1: &bRunic enchanting&r is the process of &6enchanting items using Runes&r.
university.runeenchants.desc2: Certain Runes can be enchanted in the &6Manaweaving Altar&r (see the &oEnchantments&r chapter of the Codex Arcana for each recipe), which can then be applied to certain items in the &6Runic Anvil&r.
university.runeenchants.desc3: First, place the item you want to enchant. Second, place the enchanted Rune. Finally, hammer it until the enchantment is transferred.
university.runeenchants.desc4: Every vanilla enchantment can be applied in this way, as well as &6certain unique enchantments&r (see the next two quests).
university.auraenchants.title: Aura Enchantments
university.auraenchants.subtitle: Enchant a Rune: Aura
university.auraenchants.desc1: &bAura Enchantments&r use your Mana to provide some sort of buff to yourself and nearby friendlies.
university.auraenchants.desc2: We've added them to EMI so you can see what each does.
university.auraenchants.desc3: The tasks will say "&cNo Valid Items&r." &6Ignore this&r, they work. The task needs a &bRune: Aura enchanted with any Aura enchantment&r.
university.selfishbelt.title: Lone Wolf
university.selfishbelt.subtitle: Make the Selfish Belt
university.selfishbelt.desc1: Aura effects will also apply their effects to &6nearby friendly entities&r, &cat an additional Mana cost&r.
university.selfishbelt.desc2: Some may not consider that cost worth the benefit. Some may also simply dislike these "friendly" entities. In either case, you can use the &bSelfish Belt&r.
university.selfishbelt.desc3: The Selfish Belt will &6limit Aura effects to yourself&r, which will also &6lower the Mana cost&r.
university.uniqueruneenchants.title: Fun Runic Enchantments
university.uniqueruneenchants.subtitle: Make some type of Runic Enchant
university.uniqueruneenchants.desc1: There are several new enchantments added by the mod, give the Enchantments chapter a look. These two in particular are simply rather neat.
university.uniqueruneenchants.desc2: &bBouncy&r can be applied to boots, and will &6negate fall damage&r, causing you to &6bounce upwards instead&r.
university.uniqueruneenchants.desc3: &bCloudstep&r is also applied to boots, and will &6allow you to jump in midair&r. Each level adds another jump.
university.uniqueruneenchants.desc4: The tasks will say "&cNo Valid Items&r." &6Ignore it&r, they work. The first task needs a &bRune: Earth with Bouncy&r, the second needs a &bRune: Air with Cloudstep I-III&r.
university.constructs.title: Construct Parts
university.constructs.subtitle: Make a Construct Workbench
university.constructs.desc1: &6Constructs&r are basically little magic robots that can be programmed to perform certain functions.
university.constructs.desc2: They have 5 &bpart slots&r, with the parts dictating what they can do. They can break and place blocks, move items, harvest and plant crops and trees, kill and breed mobs, and more.
university.constructs.desc3: The material the part is made out of effects the construct's stats. We've added tooltips to say what these effects are.
university.summonconstruct.title: Flip the Lever!
university.summonconstruct.subtitle: Summon your Construct
university.summonconstruct.desc: To actually &bsummon your Construct&r, you need to &6place all 5 parts on an Armor Stand&r, then sprinkle some &6Animus Dust&r on it.
university.bidding.subtitle: Make the Bell of Bidding
university.bidding.desc1: The &bBell of Bidding&r allows you to &6give your Construct simple commands&r.
university.bidding.desc2: Choose a command by opening the Bell's &6radial menu&r. Some commands require clicking the Construct, some require clicking something else.
university.bidding.desc3: For this second group, it will use either any Constructs currently following you, or the Construct bound to the Bell. Do this by sneak right-clicking the Construct with the Bell.
